acknowledgments.summary: Michael Heinzl reported these vulnerabilities to JPCERT/CC.

notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov
notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.text: All information products included in https://us-cert.cisa.gov/ics are provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. Further dissemination of this product is governed by the Traffic Light Protocol (TLP) marking in the header. For more information about TLP, see https://us-cert.cisa.gov/tlp/.
notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to disclose information or execute arbitrary code.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Critical Manufacturing
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: Worldwide
notes.title: Countries/areas deployed

notes.text: Japan
notes.title: Company headquarters location

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, and ensure they are not accessible from the Internet.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolate them from business networks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: When remote access is required, use secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), recognizing VPNs may have vulnerabilities and should be updated to the most current version available. Also recognize VPN is only as secure as its connected devices.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov/ics in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also recommends users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Do not click web links or open attachments in unsolicited email messages.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Refer to Recognizing and Avoiding Email Scams for more information on avoiding email scams.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Refer to Avoiding Social Engineering and Phishing Attacks for more information on social engineering attacks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities. These vulnerabilities are not exploitable remotely.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

document.title: JTEKT ELECTRONICS Kostac PLC Programming Software

product.name: JTEKT ELECTRONICS Kostac PLC Programing Software: Versions 1.6.9.0 and earlier

branches.name: JTEKT ELECTRONICS Kostac PLC Programing Software

notes.text: When a specially crafted project file is opened, out-of-bounds read occurs when processing a comment block in stage information because the end of data cannot be verified. CVE-2023-22419 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: JTEKT ELECTRONICS recommends users to download the following updates:

This version not only addresses the vulnerability, but also takes measures to prevent crafted project files from being opened. Project files saved with Version 1.6.9.0 or earlier can be re-saved with Version 1.6.10.0 or above to enable this tamper-proof feature. Project files saved with Version 1.6.10.0 or above cannot be opened with Version 1.6.9.0 or earlier.
For more information, see JTEKT ELECTRONICS’ Update Notice.

notes.text: When a specially crafted project file is opened, out-of-bounds read occurs because buffer size used by the PLC program instructions is insufficient. CVE-2023-22421 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: JTEKT ELECTRONICS recommends users to download the following updates:

This version not only addresses the vulnerability, but also takes measures to prevent crafted project files from being opened. Project files saved with Version 1.6.9.0 or earlier can be re-saved with Version 1.6.10.0 or above to enable this tamper-proof feature. Project files saved with Version 1.6.10.0 or above cannot be opened with Version 1.6.9.0 or earlier.
For more information, see JTEKT ELECTRONICS’ Update Notice.

notes.text: When the maximum number of columns to place the PLC program is out of specification by opening a specially crafted project file, a process accesses memory that has already been freed. CVE-2023-22424 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: JTEKT ELECTRONICS recommends users to download the following updates:

This version not only addresses the vulnerability, but also takes measures to prevent crafted project files from being opened. Project files saved with Version 1.6.9.0 or earlier can be re-saved with Version 1.6.10.0 or above to enable this tamper-proof feature. Project files saved with Version 1.6.10.0 or above cannot be opened with Version 1.6.9.0 or earlier.
For more information, see JTEKT ELECTRONICS’ Update Notice.
